title: devboard
description: Devboard is a modern, full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a developer's personal dashboard and project management tool. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, providing a robust and type-safe environment for managing tasks, notes, and other essential developer resources. This repository serves as a practical example of building a complete application using these technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotics platform.  This project provides tools for monitoring robot status, displaying sensor data, and potentially controlling robot behaviors, making it a valuable resource for managing and analyzing robotic deployments within the broader Robofleet ecosystem.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: This simple CRUD Expense Tracker, built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, utilizes Material-UI for a clean and intuitive user interface. The project allows users to easily add, read, update, and delete expense records, providing a basic yet functional tool for managing personal finances and serving as a practical example of CRUD operations implementation.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [mention the project's main functionality or goal, e.g., "creating a streamlined task management application" or "developing a personal finance tracker"]. This repository serves as the central location for the codebase, issues, and development of this project, showcasing modern web development practices and offering a potential starting point for similar undertakings.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project demonstrating a modern web dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It showcases best practices for building robust and scalable user interfaces with a focus on clean code, reusable components, and a streamlined development workflow within the Next.js framework. This repository serves as a practical example and learning resource for developers looking to implement a similar dashboard solution.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This application allows individuals to track their sleep patterns, calculate their accumulated sleep debt, and gain insights into improving their sleep habits. Focused on providing a simple and effective solution, this project leverages TypeScript for a robust and maintainable codebase.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript for brainstorming and organizing project ideas. It provides a visual and collaborative space to capture thoughts, refine concepts, and prioritize potential projects, serving as a central hub for innovation and idea management.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, and CSS. This project demonstrates a complete workflow for managing data through a web interface, showcasing how to connect a Python backend with a PostgreSQL database and present the information using HTML and CSS for the front-end. It serves as a learning resource and example for building similar applications, covering topics like database interaction, server-side logic, and front-end design.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations created using HTML and Python. This repository focuses on implementing various map-based data representations, offering a practical demonstration of how these technologies can be combined to create engaging and informative geospatial displays.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for a professional and customizable PDF output and HTML for a web-based version. It showcases my skills and experience as a project and serves as a demonstration of my proficiency in both typesetting and web development technologies.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide interactive and insightful AI conversations. This project explores modern web development techniques using a combination of frontend technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and backend technologies, offering a practical example of building AI-powered applications.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, serves as a collection of projects and tutorials exploring various aspects of finance. It aims to provide practical examples and code for analyzing financial data, building models, and gaining insights into areas like stock market analysis, portfolio optimization, and potentially other financial applications. The repository is a learning resource for those interested in applying Python to finance.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python (for backend processing), HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and understanding ROS logs, ultimately aiding in debugging and monitoring ROS-based robotics applications. It covers the "project" topic and offers an efficient way to gain insights from complex ROS system logs.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and CSS, showcasing modern web development best practices. This project enables users to create and participate in polls, providing a seamless and intuitive voting experience. It leverages JavaScript for client-side interactions and explores fundamental concepts within the "project" topic, serving as a practical example for learning and experimentation with Next.js and related technologies.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS. It leverages Supabase for backend services and database management, providing a comprehensive platform for monitoring and managing assets remotely. The project showcases best practices in TypeScript development, modern UI design, and cloud-based database integration.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project that creates a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository offers a customizable solution for displaying and managing events, allowing users to easily navigate through different months and view event details. It serves as a practical example of front-end development and project implementation using web technologies.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully functional e-commerce platform for purchasing fruits, built using Next.js 14 with the Pages Router. This project leverages TypeScript for type safety, MUI for a responsive and visually appealing user interface, and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. Explore this repository for a practical example of building a modern e-commerce application with best practices in mind.
